article:
'Radio Rentals' was formed in 1932 to rent out radio sets by Percy Perring-Thoms
with a turnover in the first year of Â£780. It later moved into televisions and
ultimately video recorders. In 1965 it merged with RentaSet, Joseph Robinson's
similarly formed company. Then in 1968 it was acquired by Thorn Electrical
Industries and joined with Thorn's DER chain (founded 1938) as part of Thorn
Television Rentals (TTR) though the two companies were run completely separately
with different staff and vehicles etc. In 1980 TTR and thus Radio Rentals became
part of the merged Thorn-EMI, and in 2000 it merged with Granada Limited to form
boxclever. The company still trades as Radio Rentals in Australia.
categories: Defunct companies of the United Kingdom
